website_summaries.verdict: If you want a lot of screen space the Plugable USB-C Triple Display 4K Docking Station is your saviour. It allows you to connect up to three external displays to your laptop or other USB-C device, including two 4K monitors at full 60Hz.

customer_reviews.title: 4K 60 hertz!  Works flawlessly with Acer Spin 13
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! This is the first product that enable me to show 4K 60 hertz on my Dell monitor. Can't say I notice a difference though. Also, unlike other cheapo USB C hub, it doesn't cut out and it glitches out when outputting to the 4K monitor. It's a bit pricey but does the job. Also, it doesn't clutter the table and you have to connect a single usb c cable to the laptop. The entire dock can sit out of sight behind the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: This works great with Google Pixelbook!
customer_reviews.text: This dock works great with Google Pixelbook utilizing 2 monitors AND the built in screen for a total of 3. We also use this configuration in a Citrix virtual desktop environment and it works with that too. I tired the Dell D3100 Dock thinking it would be a quality dock with DisplayLink compatibility but had some trouble utilizing multiple monitors (docking and undocking cause monitors to not work). This Pluggable Dock solved all the issues - very happy with it! I bought several!
customer_reviews.author: Don Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 3 monitors
customer_reviews.text: Works great with 3 monitors I bought this as I had to replace my Dell laptop which i had a E-Port dock with 3 Monitors attached I was a little bit sceptical - but went for this, and glad that I did I had it installed and working in 5 mins Charges Lenovo L590 as well as powering all monitors and peripherals Good product
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Great!
customer_reviews.text: The actual dock looks and feels very high quality, and I've found this perfect for supporting 3 additional 1080p monitors from my Spectre x360 laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Matthew Blakey

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product
customer_reviews.text: I tried many USB C with thunderbolt hubs, and they just failed to work with stability. This has been flawless and also charges the laptop at the same time. I have one 4K one 2k monitor, wireless dongle for mouse and keyboard, webcam and conference speaker all connected, and zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Savan P.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and plugged in correctly, maybe would have been good to know I needed a DisplayPort for a second monitor which is a cable I don’t have readily available. Works very well though and did the trick. Why HP don’t have something like this baffles me, their offering isn’t as strong.
customer_reviews.author: James Colvin

customer_reviews.title: It worked beautifully...
customer_reviews.text: I have a microsoft surface book 2 and with a 2-monitor setup it works beautifully...
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Eduardo Correia

customer_reviews.title: Lived up to expectation
customer_reviews.text: It is on the expensive side but it has lived up to expectation and doing everything it said it would. Working great with my HP Spectre x360 13.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device!
customer_reviews.text: The only criticism is a driver issue I'm having where Windows 10 keeps disconnecting the docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Col

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous in ordering such an expensive dock having read some of the comments regarding compatibility. I am using this with a Thinkpad A485 and it works exactly as intended. I have no need for any of the 4K connectivity, so I can't comment about that, but it is more than capable of driving a 34" ultrawide plus another 27" screen over DP & HDMI with no dramas. Screen response occasionally seems a bit laggy, but I'm not using my setup for anything that requires fast response times: As a productivity tool for work-based activities, it does everything that is required.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE PIECE OF KIT
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bit of kit. Turned one UBS C port into a mulitude of inputs. Running three monitirs plus laptop screen. Mouse, keyboard and usb desk lamp and also Ethernet cable. Best thing about this hub, lug one cable in when home and unplug one cable when you ready to be pn the move. Simple and easy to use and works as expected with windows 10 surface pro 3.
customer_reviews.author: Mitcharoo.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for home working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pair with my work Dell laptop so that I could run 3 screens while working from home. It has been a perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Voltair

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up and use works very well with Lap top and Printe/Scanner
customer_reviews.author: Mr. W. King

product_meta.title: Plugable USB-C 4K Triple Display Docking Station with Charging Support for Specific Windows USB C and Thunderbolt 3 Systems (1x HDMI and 2x DisplayPort++ Outputs, 5x USB Ports, 60W USB PD)
product_meta.description:
NOT macOS COMPATIBLE (10.13.4 version and later).

The Plugable UD-ULTC4K USB-C Dock provides up to three additional display outputs via a combination of USB-C DisplayPort Alternate Mode ("Alt Mode") and DisplayLink USB graphics. Up to 60W via USB-C Power Delivery ("PD") to charge your host computer, Gigabit Ethernet, audio, and expanded USB device connectivity. All through a single USB-C cable.

See important compatibility details below.

Graphics Performance

Main HDMI port utilizes USB-C Alt Mode, a direct "pipeline" to the host graphics processor (GPU). Connected monitor will perform as if natively attached. The 2nd-3rd outputs are powered by DisplayLink DL-6950 which leverages the host GPU+CPU. 

Alt Mode and PD Compatibility

The included power supply can charge compatible host systems with up to 60 watts of PD power, & charging speed is host dependent.

DisplayLink Graphics

Windows drivers can be installed by Windows Update (with existing Internet connection) or downloaded from plugable.com.

DisplayLink graphics require Intel / AMD / NVIDIA GPU & driver. USB graphics require dual-core 2GHz+ CPU.

Cannot be mixed with non-DisplayLink USB graphics adapters and drivers (e.g. MCT, j5, etc).

Incompatible Systems

NOT macOS COMPATIBLE (10.13.4 version and later). Phones with USB-C ports aren't compatible. Systems with ASMedia USB 3.1 controllers not compatible. HDCP/Blu-ray playback not supported, not recommended for gaming.

In the Box

UD-ULTC4K dock, 1m USB-C cable, 100W (20V, 5A) power adapter w/ EU&UK plugs
feature_bullets: Provides compatible Windows Thunderbolt 3 and USB-C systems with up to three additional displays via 1x HDMI 1.4 & 2x DisplayPort++ ports, and up to 60W of charging power. Utilizes cutting edge USB 3.1 technologies in conjunction with the latest features of our UD-6950 dock

NOT macOS COMPATIBLE (10.13.4 version and later). UD-ULTC4K is compatibile with specific Thunderbolt 3 or USB-C Windows systems such as the Microsoft Surface Book 2, Dell XPS 9350 / 9360 / 9370 / 9550 / 9560, Lenovo Yoga 720 13" & Carbon X1 5th/6th Gen, most 13" HP Spectre x360 models

HDMI and DisplayPort use different connectors and cables. Conversion of DisplayPort ports to other types is supported, but requires adapters, sold separately. Requires compatible USB-C or Thunderbolt 3 system; not compatible with legacy USB 3.0 systems. USB-C charging and Alternate Mode ("Alt Mode") video output not supported on all USB-C systems. For most current compatibility chart see Specification Sheet PDF below.

DisplayPort++ video outputs and Gigabit Ethernet via DisplayLink DL-6950. "Alt Mode" HDMI port supports up to 3840x2160 4K@30Hz; DisplayLink DisplayPort++ outputs support up to 4K@60Hz. Gaming and HDCP playback not supported
We love our Plugable products, and hope you will too. All of our products are backed with a 1 year limited parts and labor warranty as well as Seattle-based email support
